intro: Marlierea capitata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Marlierea capitata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant in containers.
